alert.note: Alert for Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Joshua Tree NP West (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued November 16 at 12:51AM PST until November 16 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...North winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. Strongest wind gusts expected through midday Wednesday. Patchy blowing dust expected. * WHERE...Western portion of Joshua Tree National Park, Chocolate Mountains, Chuckwalla Mountains and Chiriaco Summit. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Minor tree damage possible.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution.

area.areaDesc: Chiriaco Summit; Chuckwalla Mountains; Joshua Tree NP West
